contest-event.event-date:
Jan. 27, 1935 D NSW State Championships (A Grade)
NSW State Championships (A Grade) 10 Sacred, March, Set Test and Own Choice Contest NSW State Championships nsw-state-championships-a-grade
Australia
A Grade
Set Test and Own Choice
Sydney Sports Ground, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia MUSIC 2 own choice selections No.1 Selection points listed under Test
Following the new rule introduced by the Australian Band Council ,In a first for Australian bands and possibly the world percussion instruments were included .at a contest The Own Choice Selection from"Liszt "(arr McAnally) that the Bondi Beach Concert band played was the same selection (though arranged by Thomas Keighley on that occasion ) bandmaster Albert Baile won with the Newcastle Steelworks at the Bellevue contest (Eng) 1924. They were the only band that took advantage of the new rule . It had a full set of tympani etc and played splendidly by Hayden Huckstepp (The above article appeared in the "Tempo Band Journal" Feb 1935)
July 31, 2016, 11:45 p.m. Dec. 15, 2020, 12:34 a.m.
1 Randwick District (NSW) Ernest Kerry Tristan & Isolde / The Valkyrie
2 St. John Ambulance Brigade Band (District of NSW) Albert Baile Tristan & Isolde / Selections from Liszt (arr. McAnally)
3 Townsville Railway (Qld) Albert Trembath On the Cornish Coast / Life Devine
4 Westmead Old Boys Charles Coughlan Oliver Cromwell / Selections from Liszt (arr Keighley)
5 Burwood Band Bill Leahy Beethoven (arr Round) / Tristan & Isolde
